page.title: 09FARMING
page.content: slurry which is an animal produced fertiliser. Some farmers (but very few) keep chickens for their eggs. When the chickens are finished laying they are used for food. In March or April farmers sow a variety of crops. These include wheat, barley or potatoes. In August the farmer uses the combine harvester to cut the barley. The barley is made into beer or animal food. The important machines which are used on a farm are tractor, combine harvester, slurry spreader, seed drill, plough, harrow, mowing machine, turner, baler and grass blower. In many parts of our block there is bogland.These areas are too small for commercial use.Instead the farmer cuts turf from them.This is used as a fuel on his own fire during the winter.
